attributes.additional_details:
Stopping people from accessing certain places because they have not had the injection is an indirect form of coercion. You cant force someone to have it either against their will or against religious beliefs. By doing this you are breaking human rights laws and going against the Nuremburg code. 
These laws and rights were put in place after the atrocities of Hitler and WW2. What you are trying to do is wrong
attributes.background:
stop access restrictions for those not injected.
stop the coercion of the public.
realise that this is against the Nuremburg code

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575801
